alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 26 at 8:04PM MST until June 26 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 804 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 24 miles northwest of Paloma to 8 miles west of Sentinel to 14 miles southwest of Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 21 and 94. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 14 and 25. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 44 and 63. Locations impacted include... Wellton, Tacna, Sentinel, Paloma, Tyson, Dateland, Ligurta, Mohawk, Roll and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.
